00:00:28:020000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Rock Band. Sheldon is on guitar, Howard drums and Raj singing. They are performing the Red Hot Chili Peppers “Under the Bridge”. As Raj gets into the song, Penny enters and his singing turns into a squawk.
00:00:28:020000.Speaker: Penny

00:00:29:220000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Rock Band. Sheldon is on guitar, Howard drums and Raj singing. They are performing the Red Hot Chili Peppers “Under the Bridge”. As Raj gets into the song, Penny enters and his singing turns into a squawk.
00:00:29:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:29:220000.Dialogue: Penny, come on. We were just finding our sound.

00:00:34:110000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Rock Band. Sheldon is on guitar, Howard drums and Raj singing. They are performing the Red Hot Chili Peppers “Under the Bridge”. As Raj gets into the song, Penny enters and his singing turns into a squawk.
00:00:34:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:34:110000.Dialogue: You found it. It's the sound of a cat being run over by a lawn mower.

00:00:40:140000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Rock Band. Sheldon is on guitar, Howard drums and Raj singing. They are performing the Red Hot Chili Peppers “Under the Bridge”. As Raj gets into the song, Penny enters and his singing turns into a squawk.
00:00:40:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:40:140000.Dialogue: I'm really very busy. Is there any way that we can put this off until I have more time to prepare?

00:00:46:110000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Rock Band. Sheldon is on guitar, Howard drums and Raj singing. They are performing the Red Hot Chili Peppers “Under the Bridge”. As Raj gets into the song, Penny enters and his singing turns into a squawk.
00:00:46:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:46:110000.Dialogue: Of course. But, you understand my trepidation.

00:00:49:160000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Rock Band. Sheldon is on guitar, Howard drums and Raj singing. They are performing the Red Hot Chili Peppers “Under the Bridge”. As Raj gets into the song, Penny enters and his singing turns into a squawk.
00:00:49:160000.Speaker: Penny

00:00:51:140000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Rock Band. Sheldon is on guitar, Howard drums and Raj singing. They are performing the Red Hot Chili Peppers “Under the Bridge”. As Raj gets into the song, Penny enters and his singing turns into a squawk.
00:00:51:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:51:140000.Dialogue: Can't we just postpone it till the spring? Maybe next summer?

00:00:55:160000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Rock Band. Sheldon is on guitar, Howard drums and Raj singing. They are performing the Red Hot Chili Peppers “Under the Bridge”. As Raj gets into the song, Penny enters and his singing turns into a squawk.
00:00:55:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:55:160000.Dialogue: This should be fairly easy to deduce. He's holding the phone to his left ear. Ears do not cross hemispheres, so he's using the analytical rather than the emotional side of the brain, suggesting that he has no personal relationship with the caller.

00:01:08:040000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Rock Band. Sheldon is on guitar, Howard drums and Raj singing. They are performing the Red Hot Chili Peppers “Under the Bridge”. As Raj gets into the song, Penny enters and his singing turns into a squawk.
00:01:08:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:08:040000.Dialogue: No, I didn't realize it had been so long. Sure, I guess there's no other choice but to just go ahead and do it.

00:01:14:150000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Rock Band. Sheldon is on guitar, Howard drums and Raj singing. They are performing the Red Hot Chili Peppers “Under the Bridge”. As Raj gets into the song, Penny enters and his singing turns into a squawk.
00:01:14:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:14:150000.Dialogue: He's referring to an activity he has done before. It's unpleasant and needs to be repeated. This suggests some sort of invasive medical test, like perhaps a colonoscopy.

00:01:25:010000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Rock Band. Sheldon is on guitar, Howard drums and Raj singing. They are performing the Red Hot Chili Peppers “Under the Bridge”. As Raj gets into the song, Penny enters and his singing turns into a squawk.
00:01:25:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:25:010000.Dialogue: Aren't there any other options? There's not a lot of room. - It's gonna be uncomfortable.

00:01:27:160000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Rock Band. Sheldon is on guitar, Howard drums and Raj singing. They are performing the Red Hot Chili Peppers “Under the Bridge”. As Raj gets into the song, Penny enters and his singing turns into a squawk.
00:01:27:160000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:01:30:100000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Rock Band. Sheldon is on guitar, Howard drums and Raj singing. They are performing the Red Hot Chili Peppers “Under the Bridge”. As Raj gets into the song, Penny enters and his singing turns into a squawk.
00:01:30:100000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:01:33:060000.Scene: The apartment. The guys are playing Rock Band. Sheldon is on guitar, Howard drums and Raj singing. They are performing the Red Hot Chili Peppers “Under the Bridge”. As Raj gets into the song, Penny enters and his singing turns into a squawk.
00:01:33:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:33:060000.Dialogue: Okay, bye. My mother's coming to visit.

00:01:42:220000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:01:42:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:42:220000.Dialogue: How about that, you were right.

00:01:44:000000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.

00:02:15:190000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:02:15:190000.Speaker: Penny

00:02:17:070000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:02:17:070000.Speaker: Woman
00:02:17:070000.Dialogue: Yes, I can read the sign. I'm just pondering the implications.

00:02:22:170000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:02:22:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:22:170000.Dialogue: I think it implies that the elevator doesn't work.

00:02:27:140000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:02:27:140000.Speaker: Woman
00:02:27:140000.Dialogue: Again, I can read the sign. But the sign and the tape are covered with a layer of dust, which indicates that the elevator has been nonfunctional for a significant amount of time. Which suggests either a remarkable passivity among the, I assume, 24 to 36 residents of this building, based on the number of mailboxes and given typical urban population density or a shared delusion of functionality.

00:02:52:120000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:02:52:120000.Speaker: Penny

00:02:56:040000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:02:56:040000.Speaker: Leonard’s Mother
00:02:56:040000.Dialogue: I don't know if I must be, but yes.

00:02:58:210000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:02:58:210000.Speaker: Penny

00:03:00:160000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:03:00:160000.Speaker: Leonard’s Mother

00:03:02:120000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:03:02:120000.Speaker: Penny

00:03:04:100000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:03:04:100000.Speaker: Beverley

00:03:09:130000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:03:09:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:09:130000.Dialogue: Come with me. I'll walk you to the apartment.

00:03:12:090000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:03:12:090000.Speaker: Beverley
00:03:12:090000.Dialogue: Would you like to exchange pleasantries on the way?

00:03:15:220000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:03:15:220000.Speaker: Penny

00:03:19:220000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:03:19:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:19:220000.Dialogue: I've always been curious. What was Leonard like when he was little?

00:03:23:010000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:03:23:010000.Speaker: Beverley
00:03:23:010000.Dialogue: I think you mean young. He's always been little.

00:03:26:220000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:03:26:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:26:220000.Dialogue: Right. What was he like when he was young?

00:03:29:040000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:03:29:040000.Speaker: Beverley
00:03:29:040000.Dialogue: You'll have to be more specific.

00:03:32:200000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:03:32:200000.Speaker: Penny

00:03:40:030000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:03:40:030000.Speaker: Penny

00:03:41:110000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:03:41:110000.Speaker: Beverley
00:03:41:110000.Dialogue: At that age, he was well enmeshed in what Freud would call the phallic stage of psychosexual development. An outmoded theory, of course, but the boy did spend most of his waking hours with a tight grasp on his penis.

00:03:53:160000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:03:53:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:53:160000.Dialogue: Leonard mentioned you were a psychiatrist.

00:03:55:220000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:03:55:220000.Speaker: Beverley
00:03:55:220000.Dialogue: That is one of my degrees. My primary field is neuroscience.

00:04:00:170000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:04:00:170000.Speaker: Penny

00:04:07:080000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:04:07:080000.Speaker: Beverley

00:04:10:060000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:04:10:060000.Speaker: Penny

00:04:11:160000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:04:11:160000.Speaker: Beverley
00:04:11:160000.Dialogue: There are studies that suggest that many who go into the performing arts suffer from an external locus of identity.

00:04:21:030000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:04:21:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:21:030000.Dialogue: Yeah, I don't know what that means.

00:04:24:220000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:04:24:220000.Speaker: Beverley
00:04:24:220000.Dialogue: It means you value yourself only as others value you, which is often the result of unmet childhood emotional needs.

00:04:33:140000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:04:33:140000.Speaker: Penny

00:04:36:120000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:04:36:120000.Speaker: Beverley

00:04:39:150000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:04:39:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:39:150000.Dialogue: I know my dad wanted a boy.

00:04:45:210000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:04:45:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:45:210000.Dialogue: I tried being good at sports, but I hated getting dirty!

00:04:51:120000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:04:51:120000.Speaker: Beverley
00:04:51:120000.Dialogue: And then, I'm assuming, you entered adolescence.

00:04:54:120000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:04:54:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:54:120000.Dialogue: He called me Slugger until I got my first training bra. And then he just stopped playing catch with me.

00:05:01:180000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:05:01:180000.Speaker: Penny

00:05:06:210000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:05:06:210000.Speaker: Penny

00:05:13:170000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:05:13:170000.Speaker: Beverley
00:05:13:170000.Dialogue: If you want to have intercourse with that girl, find out what kind of cologne her father wore.

00:05:22:030000.Scene: The lobby. Penny finds a woman studying the lift.
00:05:22:030000.Speaker: Leonard

00:05:27:230000.Speaker: Beverley
00:05:27:230000.Dialogue: Oolong? Loose, not bagged? Steeped three minutes? Two-percent milk? Warmed separately? One teaspoon sugar? Raw sugar?

00:05:47:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:47:160000.Dialogue: I have the same problem with him.

00:05:52:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:52:130000.Dialogue: My theory is that his lack of focus stems from an over-developed sex drive.

00:05:58:130000.Speaker: Beverley
00:05:58:130000.Dialogue: I don't know where he would've gotten that. Aside from a pro forma consummation of our marriage, his father and I only had intercourse for the purposes of reproduction.

00:06:08:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:08:130000.Dialogue: That seems a fairly efficient arrangement.

00:06:11:170000.Speaker: Beverley
00:06:11:170000.Dialogue: Yes, we think so. We've both done papers on it. Mine from the neuroscientific point of view and his from an anthropological. Mine, of course, was the onlyne worth reading.

00:06:22:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:22:050000.Dialogue: Of course. I would very much like to read about your sex life.

00:06:27:230000.Speaker: Beverley
00:06:27:230000.Dialogue: It's all online or you can order it from the Princeton University Press.

00:06:32:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:32:020000.Dialogue: Here's your tea, Mother. So, what are you guys talking about?

00:06:36:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:36:170000.Dialogue: The frequency with which your parents had intercourse.

00:06:41:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:41:100000.Dialogue: Swell. If you're lucky, maybe she'll show you the PowerPoint presentation.

00:06:47:060000.Speaker: Beverley
00:06:47:060000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, it's on my other laptop.

00:06:53:170000.Speaker: Beverley
00:06:53:170000.Dialogue: - You'll have to be more specific.

00:06:57:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:57:210000.Dialogue: All right. What's new with you?

00:07:00:150000.Speaker: Beverley
00:07:00:150000.Dialogue: Well, I've been having some fascinating menopausal symptoms recently.

00:07:28:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:28:010000.Dialogue: Yeah, I-I thought you guys might hit it off.

00:07:33:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:33:070000.Dialogue: I hate to tell you, but the only warm memories I have of my childhood are of my Uncle Floyd.

00:07:39:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:39:150000.Dialogue: You're clearly misremembering. Your mother is brilliant, analytical, insightful. And I'm betting she never hit you with a Bible because you wouldn't eat your Brussels sprouts.

00:07:49:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:49:040000.Dialogue: You don't give your mother enough credit. She's warm, she's loving, she doesn't glue electrodes to your head to measure your brain waves while potty training.

00:07:59:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:59:070000.Dialogue: You were lucky. When I was a kid, if I wanted an EEG, I had to attach my own electrodes.

00:08:07:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:07:230000.Dialogue: So, Dr. Hofstadter, Leonard rarely talks about his incredibly successful brother and sister.

00:08:15:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:15:230000.Dialogue: I understand that, unlike Leonard, they're at the top of their respective fields.

00:08:25:220000.Speaker: Beverley
00:08:25:220000.Dialogue: Leonard's younger brother, Michael, is a tenured law professor at Harvard, and his sister just successfully grew a human pancreas in an adolescent gibbon.

00:08:35:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:35:200000.Dialogue: So, she's close to curing diabetes?

00:08:38:140000.Speaker: Beverley
00:08:38:140000.Dialogue: Why else would you grow a pancreas in a teenaged gibbon?

00:09:01:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:01:060000.Dialogue: I had no idea your siblings were so much more successful than you.

00:09:06:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:06:110000.Dialogue: You're like the Jar Jar Binks of the Hofstadter family.

00:09:11:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:11:220000.Dialogue: Oh, mesa think yousa lookin' so so sad.

00:09:17:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:17:050000.Dialogue: Rather than mock me, my friends might realize that this is difficult and try to help me through it.

00:09:23:010000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:23:010000.Dialogue: Nope, I think mocking you is more fun.

00:09:26:160000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:26:160000.Dialogue: Next time, don't yousa bring mama to work. Okee-day?

00:09:37:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:37:210000.Dialogue: That's totally understandable. In bladder voiding, as in real estate, it's location, location, location.

00:09:52:170000.Speaker: Beverley
00:09:52:170000.Dialogue: That's fascinating. Selective mutism is quite rare. On the other hand, an adult Jewish male living with his mother is so common it borders on sociological clich\E9.

00:10:05:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:05:080000.Dialogue: It's just temporary; I pay rent.

00:10:07:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:07:080000.Dialogue: He lives in the same room where his bassinet was.

00:10:09:230000.Speaker: Beverley
00:10:09:230000.Dialogue: Both selective mutism and an inability to separate from one's mother can stem from a pathological fear of women. It might explain why the two of you have created an ersatz homosexual marriage to satisfy your need for intimacy.

00:10:33:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:33:230000.Dialogue: That's basically what I just said.

00:10:36:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:36:140000.Dialogue: You brought your husband to work. You know the rules.

00:10:41:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:41:200000.Dialogue: Meesa thinking yousa looking pretty sad now too, betcha, betcha.

00:10:45:220000.Speaker: Beverley
00:10:45:220000.Dialogue: Leonard, it's 1:00. Weren't you going to show me your laboratory at 1:00?

00:10:49:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:49:120000.Dialogue: There's no hurry. Tell them more about their secret love for each other.

00:10:53:110000.Speaker: Beverley
00:10:53:110000.Dialogue: But it's 1:00. You were going to show me your laboratory at 1:00.

00:10:56:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:56:170000.Dialogue: Her reasoning is unassailable. It is 1:00.

00:11:04:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:04:230000.Dialogue: I think you'll find my work pretty interesting. I'm attempting to replicate the dark matter signal found in sodium iodide crystals by the Italians.

00:11:16:100000.Speaker: Beverley
00:11:16:100000.Dialogue: What's the point of my seeing it? I could just read the paper the Italians wrote.

00:11:23:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:11:23:060000.Dialogue: Just for the record, we're not in an ersatz homosexual relationship.

00:11:27:070000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:27:070000.Dialogue: - Then why didn't you say that to her?

00:11:31:030000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:31:030000.Dialogue: It's not always your responsibility. I swear, this is the same thing you did at the comic book store last week.

00:11:40:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:11:40:050000.Dialogue: I can't believe you're bringing that up.

00:11:47:090000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:47:090000.Dialogue: You always say that, but you never do.

00:11:55:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:55:190000.Dialogue: You went to the comic book store without me?

00:12:11:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:11:070000.Dialogue: Wait, she's not gonna come here looking for you, is she?

00:12:14:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:14:010000.Dialogue: Relax. She took Sheldon to the hospital to get a brain scan.

00:12:19:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:19:050000.Dialogue: Nothing. Mother likes looking at brains and Sheldon likes getting his brain scanned.

00:12:27:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:27:160000.Dialogue: She's only been here a day and a half and I'm seriously considering alcoholism as a new career path.

00:12:33:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:33:130000.Dialogue: I talked to her for 5 minutes yesterday and I've been half bombed ever since.

00:12:38:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:38:160000.Dialogue: You can't let her get into your head.

00:12:48:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:48:020000.Dialogue: She was right. The locus of my identity is totally exterior to me.

00:12:52:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:52:150000.Dialogue: Yeah, there she is. Hi, Mom.

00:12:57:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:57:180000.Dialogue: Do you know where I was all morning? Auditioning with 50 other blondes for some stupid antidepressant commercial. And for what? So I'll finally get my daddy's approval?

00:13:17:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:17:070000.Dialogue: You want to talk about not getting love from a parent. You know what I used to do when I was little to have some sensation of human contact?

00:13:23:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:23:140000.Dialogue: Yeah, you grabbed your penis and wouldn't let go.

00:13:34:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:34:010000.Dialogue: Of course she did. That's not what I was gonna say. When I was ten years old, I built a hugging machine.

00:13:43:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:43:010000.Dialogue: I got a dressmaker's mannequin, I stuffed it with an electric blanket so it would be warm, and built two radio-controlled arms that would hug me and pat my back.

00:13:55:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:55:040000.Dialogue: You know what the saddest part was?  My father used to borrow it.

00:14:02:190000.Speaker: Beverley
00:14:02:190000.Dialogue: Your scan data will be very helpful to my research. You have a remarkable brain.

00:14:10:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:10:150000.Dialogue: Although I've always hated how my right frontal lobe looks in pictures.

00:14:15:220000.Speaker: Beverley
00:14:15:220000.Dialogue: Common complaint among men. Nothing's ever big enough.

00:14:20:030000.Speaker: Beverley
00:14:20:030000.Dialogue: Except when they get a tumor. Then you never hear the end of it.

00:14:25:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:25:010000.Dialogue: I'd love to see a scan of your brain sometime.

00:14:28:010000.Speaker: Beverley
00:14:28:010000.Dialogue: I'll send you a link, but its physiology is fairly unimpressive.

00:14:33:080000.Speaker: Beverley
00:14:33:080000.Dialogue: Your unwillingness to accept empirical evidence suggests an attempt at flattery.

00:14:39:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:39:220000.Dialogue: My apologies. I've been living with your son too long. Gotten into some bad habits.

00:14:47:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:47:200000.Dialogue: - Can I make you a cup of tea?

00:14:57:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:57:040000.Dialogue: I feel very comfortable around you.

00:15:00:200000.Speaker: Beverley
00:15:00:200000.Dialogue: I feel very comfortable around you, too.

00:15:03:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:03:060000.Dialogue: It's surprising because I generally don't feel comfortable around... well, anyone.

00:15:12:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:12:050000.Dialogue: What are the odds that two individuals as unique as ourselves would be connected by someone as comparatively workaday as your son?

00:15:22:210000.Speaker: Beverley
00:15:22:210000.Dialogue: Is that a rhetorical point or would you like to do the math?

00:15:27:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:27:190000.Dialogue: I'd like to do the math.

00:15:32:070000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny and Leonard are doing tequila shots.
00:15:32:070000.Speaker: Beverley

00:15:33:000000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny and Leonard are doing tequila shots.

00:15:51:080000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny and Leonard are doing tequila shots.
00:15:51:080000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:51:080000.Dialogue: Now this time, you're gonna lick the salt... off my neck...

00:16:00:040000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny and Leonard are doing tequila shots.
00:16:00:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:00:040000.Dialogue: do the shot... and then... bite the lime.

00:16:10:070000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny and Leonard are doing tequila shots.
00:16:10:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:10:070000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, I didn't hear anything after lick.

00:16:14:230000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny and Leonard are doing tequila shots.
00:16:14:230000.Speaker: Penny

00:16:27:030000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny and Leonard are doing tequila shots.
00:16:27:030000.Speaker: Penny

00:16:35:230000.Scene: Penny’s apartment. Penny and Leonard are doing tequila shots.
00:16:35:230000.Speaker: Leonard

00:17:04:130000.Speaker: Beverley
00:17:04:130000.Dialogue: I'm very tempted. I'm just not sure it's appropriate with my son's roommate.

00:17:11:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:11:150000.Dialogue: Normally, I'd feel the same way. But based on everything I've observed about us, I can't help but speculate we'd be very good together.

00:17:20:030000.Speaker: Beverley
00:17:20:030000.Dialogue: True. I've had a similar observation. It's certainly something I could never do with my husband.

00:17:29:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:29:090000.Dialogue: I was hesitant the first time I tried it, but I experienced an unanticipated and remarkable release of endorphins.

00:17:42:040000.Speaker: Beverley
00:17:42:040000.Dialogue: I see what you're doing. You're appealing to the neuroscientific researcher in me.

00:17:49:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:49:020000.Dialogue: You see right through me, don't you?

00:17:53:100000.Speaker: Beverley
00:17:53:100000.Dialogue: Only when you're in a CAT scanner.

00:18:04:100000.Scene: Penny’s bedroom. Penny and Leonard are in bed.
00:18:04:100000.Speaker: Leonard

00:18:08:020000.Scene: Penny’s bedroom. Penny and Leonard are in bed.
00:18:08:020000.Speaker: Penny

00:18:09:170000.Scene: Penny’s bedroom. Penny and Leonard are in bed.
00:18:09:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:09:170000.Dialogue: You shush, I'm happy. I want to talk about it.

00:18:13:020000.Scene: Penny’s bedroom. Penny and Leonard are in bed.
00:18:13:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:13:020000.Dialogue: You know what my mother would say? She would say because you weren't loved by your father and I was not loved by my mother, that having sex is our way of making up for the intimacy we didn't get as children.

00:18:23:060000.Scene: Penny’s bedroom. Penny and Leonard are in bed.
00:18:23:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:23:060000.Dialogue: Why would you bring that up right now?

00:18:26:150000.Scene: Penny’s bedroom. Penny and Leonard are in bed.
00:18:26:150000.Speaker: Leonard

00:18:31:140000.Scene: Penny’s bedroom. Penny and Leonard are in bed.
00:18:31:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:31:140000.Dialogue: So you're saying you're not having sex with me, you're having sex with your mother?

00:18:37:140000.Scene: Penny’s bedroom. Penny and Leonard are in bed.
00:18:37:140000.Speaker: Leonard

00:18:40:230000.Scene: Penny’s bedroom. Penny and Leonard are in bed.
00:18:40:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:40:230000.Dialogue: That is the sickest thing I've ever heard.

00:18:43:050000.Scene: Penny’s bedroom. Penny and Leonard are in bed.
00:18:43:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:43:050000.Dialogue: Come on, you're trying to have sex with your father and I'm okay with that.

00:18:56:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:56:060000.Dialogue: She said shush. I should have shushed.

00:19:24:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:24:040000.Dialogue: All right, Mother. Have a nice flight.

00:19:27:100000.Speaker: Beverley
00:19:27:100000.Dialogue: That's not really in my control, is it?

00:19:45:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:19:45:160000.Dialogue: - I was just coming over to talk to you.

00:20:00:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:20:00:030000.Dialogue: I mean, my mom could've just said, Bob, get over it, she's a girl, move on.

00:20:06:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:20:06:150000.Dialogue: - But she didn't. Not one word.
